--- title: "Welcome to STA 221 labs!" author: "January 10, 2025" footer: "[ðŸ”— STA 221 - Spring 2025](https://sta221-sp25.netlify.app)" logo: "../images/logo.png" format: revealjs: theme: slides.scss multiplex: false transition: fade slide-number: true incremental: false chalkboard: true execute: freeze: auto echo: true knitr: opts_chunk: R.options: width: 200 --- # Welcome to STA 221! ## Meet your TAs! ![](images/hello-sticker.jpeg){fig-alt="Sticker that says \"Hello my name is\"" fig-align="center"} ## Meet each other! ::: midi - Get into groups of 2 or 3 - Introduce yourself: Name, year, major (or academic interest), a highlight from winter break or something you're looking forward to this semester - Introduce your partner to the class ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
03:00
``` ::: ::: ## What to expect in lab - Introduction to the lab assignment (\~ 5 - 10 minutes) - Review lecture content, as needed (\~ 10 minutes) - Work on the lab assignment (individual for Lab 01 and in teams for the remainder of the semester) - Starting with Lab 01, you will find the starter materials for lab in your repo in the course GitHub organization. # Any questions? ## Today's lab {.midi} The rest of the today's lab is focused on setting up the computing for the course and completing the class survey. Click the link below for the Lab 00 instructions. The instructions are available on the course website. Your TA will demonstrate the steps to set up computing and interact with RStudio and GitHub.
